<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Poisoner's Twist](/Feats.aspx?ID=6383) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 210 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Poisoner](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=259)

**Prerequisites**
[Poisoner Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6382); Trained in [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=42)

**Requirements**
Your last action was a successful melee [Strike](/Actions.aspx?ID=2306) that dealt damage against a target afflicted by a poison, and you know which poison.

</column>

---

Poisons attack specific parts of the body—one venom might target the lungs, another the circulatory system, while another deteriorates the nerves. You know how to take advantage of such weaknesses. You deal 1d6 damage of the required [Strike](/Actions.aspx?ID=2306)'s damage type and 1d6 [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) damage to the target. If you're at least 18th level, you deal 2d6 damage of each type.
